episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the world record for breath-holding, Nikola Tesla attending a party with a stripper jumping out of a cake, Queen Louise of Sweden's precautionary card for London visits, and unusual speeding incidents involving children and the elderly in the UK.

facts.fact: The world record for the longest time spent holding one's breath is exactly the same length as this podcast episode.
Nikola Tesla was one of the guests at the first ever party with a stripper jumping out of a cake.
When in London, Queen Louise of Sweden always carried a card saying, "I am the queen of Sweden" in case she was hit by a bus.
Last year in the UK, two eight-year-olds were caught speeding.
